Program Title: Master of Science in Computer Science
Program Overview: Structured program focusing on advanced topics in computer science, including AI and data mining
Core Courses: Algorithms and Complexity Theory (CSCE 525/5221) – 3 credits, Distributed Systems (CSCE 545/5241) – 3 credits, Advanced Artificial Intelligence (CSCE 565/5261) – 3 credits
Specializations/Tracks: Tailored electives in Data Mining, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence
Elective Courses: Advanced Data Mining (CSCE 664/6261) – 3 credits, Computational Machine Learning (CSCE 527/5262) – 3 credits
Capstone/Project Requirement: 9-credit thesis with original research
Internship/Practicum: Not specified, practical experience through research projects
Program Learning Outcomes: Proficiency in analyzing computing problems, advanced techniques, conducting research
Skills and Tools Emphasized: Algorithms, distributed systems, AI, machine learning, data mining
Faculty Profiles: Faculty with expertise in AI, data mining, distributed systems
Research Labs/Initiatives: Access to labs and research groups in machine learning and AI
Research Opportunities: Research opportunities through the thesis component and faculty collaboration
